channel.title: PKGBUILD on Arthur’s Almanac
channel.description: Recent content in PKGBUILD on Arthur’s Almanac

item.title: Arch Linux
item.author: graeme@rthur.me (Graeme Arthur)
item.description:
Arch Linux is a Linux distribution that uses a rolling release model, such that a regular system update is all that is needed to obtain all the latest software. The design approach follows the KISS principle (“keep it simple, stupid”) and focuses on elegance, code correctness, minimalism and simplicity.

  • Organisation: Arch Linux
  • Date: December 2013 - December 2016
  • Role: Trusted user & Package maintainer
item.summary: Arch Linux Trusted User & Package maintainer
